ranked_diseases.explanation: All three reference cases with identical phenotype (cleft palate, intellectual disability, global developmental delay) were diagnosed with Glass syndrome, making it the most likely diagnosis.
Features cleft palate, intellectual disability, and developmental delay as core features. Caused by mutations in KMT2D gene.
X-linked form of Kabuki syndrome with similar features including cleft palate and intellectual disability. Caused by KDM6A mutations.
Characterized by intellectual disability, developmental delay, and cleft palate among other features. Caused by 4p deletion.
Features intellectual disability and developmental delay; cleft palate occurs in approximately 20% of cases.
DiGeorge/velocardiofacial syndrome includes cleft palate, intellectual disability, and developmental delays as common features.
Primarily characterized by cleft palate/lip; intellectual disability is less common but can occur with this condition.
